key_points: Dominick Black, 19, from Kenosha, pleads not guilty to charges related to buying Kyle Rittenhouse a rifle.
Charged with two counts of felony for intentionally selling a dangerous weapon to a person under 18, resulting in death.
Attorney Anthony Cotton files request to dismiss the charges against Black.
Black allegedly purchased the AR-15-style rifle with money from Rittenhouse, who was 17 at the time.
The weapon was bought because Rittenhouse was underage and kept at Black's stepdad's house in Kenosha.
Rittenhouse, from Illinois, used the rifle to kill two people during protests in Kenosha.
The incident took place on Aug. 25, where Rittenhouse allegedly shot Joseph Rosenbaum and Anthony Huber.
Each count against Black is punishable up to three years in prison.
Kyle Rittenhouse faces charges including 1st-degree intentional homicide, claiming self-defense. His trial begins this fall.
Dominick Black's final pre-trial hearing is scheduled for July 29.
